text: Tap at 100 piv. Quite watery but that is to be expected from beer of this ABV. Slightly soapy, but mostly fruity citrusy hoppiness present. Very refreshing, easy drinking.
Bottle from Fea. Pours clear golden with white head. Citrusy aroma and taste with hay, onion and floral notes. Decent.
Ljust gyllengul öl med ett lätt vitt skum. Doft och smak av citrusfrukter, blommighet, jäst, gräs och hö. Något tunn kropp.
Bottle from beer[malade].  Hazy yellow color with thick white head. Distinct citrus hoppy aroma. Taste, citrus hops, wheat, yeast. Very good.
风格：American Wheat Beer（反正 To Ol自己是这么标
Sweet hoppy aroma. Light orange complexion. Watered down honey sweetness. Dirt/earth aftertaste.
Bon arôme houblonné. Mousse abondante.Bière trouble. Très gazeuse. Gout de houblon qui prédomine mais assez floteuse. Larrière gout est trop faible.

Bottle 33cl.
@ 2D2Dspuma Tienda, Barcelona, Spain.
A: Hazy golden.
T: Malt, citrus, fruity.

Color amarillo pálido con capa de espuma blanca de burbujas muy amplias de tres dedos de grosor (buena retención). Carbonatación a tope. Aroma cítrico, suave y mínimo. Sabor muy cítrico (estilo limonada), con deje ligeramente amargo final (podían habérselo currado un poquito más) y herbal. Disfrutable, pero eso de tomarse una tras otra... Trabajad las cosas como sabéis, To Øl, y luego ya veremos... Las milongas contádselas a otros.
Decent, but nothing more. This session has a decent amount of hops, floral, but rather uninteresting.

Botella de @El Lúpulo Feroz, Oviedo 08/10/2016. 
Color amarillo, sabor frutal, final amargo y seco.
Gyllengul, disig med medelhögt vitt skum. Lite skum doft med aningen stekt lök jämte torr citrus. Lätt, frisk och aningen syrlig, torr, lätt beska och ganska anonyma citrussmaker. Ok.
backlog. bottle. Pale with a white head. Some slight grapefruit and grass in the aroma. Dry mouthfeel. Thin as expected. Nice bitterness but lacks a tiny bit from being outstanding.

From Beergium. In Teku glass. At dinner, with pizza (cheese + york) It as a very dry citric and grassy bitterness that compensates fairly well its thin body. To repeat when in mood for something with low ABV

Bottle at home, 17/07/16.
Hazed orange golden with a well appointed off white head that retains well.
Nose is melon, passionfruit, tangerine, light floral notes, citric sherbets, fresh grass.
Taste comprises light pine, toasted malt, melon, tangerine, citric sherbets, straw, papaya.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close peppered with juicy hop bitterness.
Solid juicy hop session gear ... lots of flavour for the ABV.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bang on what a session IPA should be. Low ABV at 3% but no lack of fruity bitterness from the hops - grapefruit, peach and exotic fruit. Light in the malt. Now if only I could source a crate locally ...

0,33 l bottle 
pale, hazy, frothy, white foam, citrus, spruce, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, light body, thin feel, slick feel, lively, long finish,

Ciekawy, lagerowy (pszeniczno-jęczmienny) aromat z kwaskowatooctową nutą i przyjemnym, amerykańskim zapachem. Ten zapach troche przypomina mi Witbiera z Blanche De Namur. W smaku kwaskowato-wytrawnie, mało ciała, bardzo sesyjne piwo. Orzeźwia i szybko znika. Całkiem niezłe.

Bottle 33cl. Poured into a shaker. Cloudy pale golden, tall rocky macropore white head, good retention, heavy lacing; aroma pale malts, grapefruit, apricot, pine, lemon grass; thin taste, medium sweet and bitter, grainy, malty, light fruity, hoppy; average duration, dry grainy aftertaste, herbal notes; light body, watery texture, average carbonation; not bad for a low alcohol beer but not my thing.

Review based on the BJCP2015 guidelines (style 21A, low session strength - adapted) Bottle 33 cl - Batch unknown. AROMA: predominant hop aroma with notes of tropical fruits (grapefruit, mango) and some resin. very faint malty sweet and neutral background. APPEARANCE: pale gold color and hazy. very large white head with medium retention. TASTE: mild flavour of hops similiar to the aroma (tropical fruits, resin). very faint malty neutral background. moderate bitterness with a semi-dry finish. PALATE: medium-low to low body. excessive carbonation. OVERALL: a nice and refreshing hop-centric low alcohol beer.

WYGLĄD: Barwa żółte, zmętnione. Piana drobna, wysoka, trwała, nieśmiało oblepia szkło.
AROMAT: Średnio intensywny. Krótko: czarna porzeczka. 
SMAK: Nieznacznie owocowe. Z dość wyraźną kontrą cytrusową. Goryczka średnia, krótka. Mocno nasycone przez co jest orzeźwiające.
OGÓLNIE: Bardzo lekkie piwo z fajną goryczką. Wcale nie jest tak wodniste jak się obawiałem.
Bottle. Grapefruit, elderflower, lychee, strong bitterness. Watery and overcarbonated but crisp enough to justify its place in the beer world.

Flaska @ Majas Vid Havet. Klar guldfärgad med ett stort vitt skum. Dofter av citrus, blomster, nektarin och tall. Rejäl beska i smaken som inte riktigt backas upp tillräckligt av någon sötma, vilket leder till en stickig munkänsla. Förvånansvärt stor kropp sett till alkoholprocenten. Smakinslag av gräs, citrus, blomster och tall.
Cest la fiesta du pamplemousse sec voir même "mega dry" ... Cest un peu que ça aussi .. Donc on peut trouver ça lassant ... Surtout vers la fin ...

33cl bottle. Cloudy golden pour with frothy white head, lots of lacing. Aromas of grass, dry leaves and dough. Taste is medium bitter, dry but balanced. Aftertaste is bitter and long with nice, dry finish. Great beer, would not believe the low alcohol...

330 ml bottle from Ammersin 5, Vienna.
Pale yellow, hazy body, with a big, frothy, rocky, lacing, white head.
Aroma of citrus, tangerine, apricot, grass, fresh herbs, flowers, candy.
Taste is quite watery, but still nice, with lemon, fresh minty herbs, grass, some hemp, candy.
Light mouthfeel, with a low carbonation.
Finishes medium bitter, citric, minty, grassy, a bit malty.

Nice one. Really good low alcohol beer, light, but aromatic and crisp. Nice balance between lemon and lovely minty herb notes. Very refreshing summer beer.

330 ml. bottle poured into a Pint glass Appearance....... Hazy yellow beer with faoamy head colour white of 2. 5 fingers aprox Aroma............... Cereals and lemon aroma predominance Taste........ Some citric notes and then hop , touch of bitterness and malt lasting in mouth all the time. Mouthfeel........... medium body and soft carbonation Overall............ a very recomendable ale.
Pale orange colour, huge soappy white head. Aroma of soap, hops. Taste is light to medium bitter a bit sour. Light bidy, thin texture, lively carbonation.
grassy, palma violets, cloudy pale gold with a frothy white head, quite fizzy bland lemonade flavour. weird aftertaste.

Bottle camping in France. Hazy yellow pour, thin creamy white head. Aroma of citrus fruits, some lime, slightly spicy and a hint of vegetables. Flavor is quite bitter, a bit thin, quite some citrus and a bit of cardboard.
Aroma and flavour have elements that are a bit musty and like wet cardboard. Other flavours are somewhat subdued. Quite thin and watery.
Bottle 0.33 l. Cloudy yellow with white foam. Aroma: very spicy, hop granules, citrus and fruits. Taste: watery, slightly earthy hop bitterness, fruits, refreshing.
Cloudy yellow, frothy head of big bubbles. Floral, citric, fruity aroma. Light body. Dry taste with earthy profile. Fruity as well. Interesting session beer.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
An easy beer, with some citrous and sour notes. Good for mediterranean hot summer.

On tap at 6 Pack in Busan. 
Sundancer a gold pour with a nice head. The nose is fairly hoppy with a solid yeast character. Great body and hoppiness for a low ABV. Solid

Bue en bouteille de 33cl à la brasserie, couleur blonde, mousse moyenne tout comme leffervescence. Une bière vraiment avec une chouette attaque houblonnée sur lecitron et le pamplemousse le manque dalcool fait très vite tomber le goût mais cest bon.

Bue en bouteille de 33cl. Blonde trouble. Nez sublime, houblonné et arômes de poire, d'agrumes et de fruits jaunes. Au palais, peu effervescent, gros houblonnage. Finale à peine aqueuse certainement à cause de faible taux d'alcool

Bottle from Brewdog.

Pours orange-yellow with single finger white head, mild carbonation. Aroma of peach and mango, not much malt really. Flavour is much the same, could do with some malt backbone though to give it a boost of life!
Aroma of citrus, lemon, grass, tropical fruits, fresh hops. Flavour is light sweet with a moderate bitter finish. Thin but nicely drinkable and refreshing.
Un buona birra fresca e delicata, un po fruttata, e di luppolo ce nè una palata! Ottimo lavoro di to ol!!

Aroma: Hoppy with some fruity sweetness.
Flavor: Fruity bitter with some sweetness, a dry finish and a watery mouthfeel.
Colro: Light amber with a white head.

To ol sun dancer: bottle, 2.7% percent, the right kind of beer for the middle of a hot day. I chilled it in the soca river, and it pours a hazy to murky light orange. The aroma is wonderful: juicy peach and mango, no malt at all, just hops. The flavour is, as expected, not quite there: the body is just too weak to carry those hops. There is more of a bitter citrus impression in the flavour. Still, very nice.

UPDATED: JAN 16, 2015 Lightly opalescent solid sunyellow colour with a frothy medium fading white head. On the nose aromas of citrus/grapefruit, a bit wet grass and hints of straw basement dustyness arises. A light livelyness opens up for a soft light bodied texture with flavours of wheat, grass, citrus and some earthyness. Flavour attributes of light sourness and light bitterness are harmonically developping on the palate. The finish dries somewhat but quenches the thirst!
Draft at Fermentoren, Aarhus. Light yellow hazy body and a rocky white head. Fresh hops in the nose and aroma but fade away quit fast. The taste is light sweet and medium bitter. Thin watery body.

Tap at Fermentoren Aarhus. Pours medium clear, light yellow with a small, fragile, white head. Aroma has some odd barn-yard to it. Like infected grains or something. Besides that exotic, hoppy, perfumed fruits, elderflower, pineapple and orange. Taste has hints of the grainy, or almost cheese-like flavor as well. This do though get drowned in the crispy, fruity hops, that has lots of peach and grassy bitterness. Crispy, watery body and a medium-high carbonation. Im not fully convinced though.
Draught. Hazy yellow colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, hops and citrus.

Hazy yellow body and stable cristal clean white head. Citrus, light pale malts, refined and appealing. Very dry but surprisingly full for the abv. Very tasty, although not too complex of course. (33cl bottle from Bière Révolution)

Bottle consumed at Cropredy Fairports Annual Reunion Festival, Cropredy, Oxon, Friday 8th August 2014   Wonderfully simple hoppy beer, its a little thin and just a bit watery but hey surely thats to be expected, however for a 2.7% beer its really quite decent and I thoroughly enjoyed this its hoppy, refreshing and did really well against the big American hop monster I also had.  A7 A4 T7 P3 Ov14 3.5
Bottle at Craigs. Pours light amber, nose is light lemon, pine, taste is similar, bitter.
Tap @ Kaapse Brouwers. Hazy pale yellow colour, white head. Nose is tropical fruits, lots of lemon. Flavour is plenty of lemon, bit tropical fruits. A bit light bodied, watery.

Bottle from Andrew. Hazy pale golden body with a thick white head. Steady carbonation. Light lacing. Aroma of lemongrass and dusty citrus. Flavour of tonic water, lime and yeast. Thin body with a slightly oily mouthfeel. Soft fizz. Refreshing but not the most interesting.

Bottle. Hazy golden yellow beer with a large white head. Aroma is fruity with notes of wheat, citrus, pine, grains and yeast. Flavor is spicy with notes of citrus, pine, herbs and wheat. Refreshing and thin bodied.

How: Bottle.
Where: Urban Deli Nytorget, Stockholm.
Appearance: Hazy golden colour with a white head.
Aroma: Citrus, hops, sweet malt, floral.
Body: Light body, medium carbonation.
Flavour: Citrus, floral, hops, herbs.

Bottle from BottleDog and drunk at home. Hazy pale gold lasting white head. Very leafy hoppy aroma and flavour. Tangerine, satsuma and tropical fruits. Highly drinkable. Decent bitterness on the finish. Really nice.

Draught @ Fermentoren, Århus. Pours palee yellow with a white head. Aroma of light malt, wheat, fruit, citrus. Flavor is light malty, wheat, citrus, lemonpeel. Thin body, average carbonation, easy to drink, light bitter finish. 120714

w aromacie grejpfrut wraz ze skorka, lekki agrest i winogrona, lekka mirabelka, czyli owocowo. w smaku wytrawne, choc niskie nasycenie powoduje zlude kremowosci, co bardzo fajne, grejpfrutowo goryczkowe, lekki popiol, finisz sredni, przyjemny. orzezwiajace i pijalne.

Bona cervesa, es bastant equilibrada i gustosa.
Buena cerveza, es bastante equilibrada y sabrosa.

A mid-sized snowy white head, over a hazy yellow body. Fruit-cocktail nose. Properly light-bodied. Well-balanced fruity hops and crisp malt flavor. A tasty and moreish L/A. [Bottle bought at Kihosh, København]

33 cl. bottle @ home. Procured from Willems. Pours a hazy, lighter straw golden with a nicely fluffy head. Smells of very fruity citrus hops, light peel & grass, touch floral, very juicy & faintly exotic. Tastes of sweet juicy citrus peel hops mixed with grass and sweet white bread dough, some powdery yeast feel to it. Very easy to drink. Reminds me a little bit of Taras Boulba, anyway this is amazing more brewers should make beers like this & also this is very fluffy.
On tap at Biercab. Golden colour with white head. Malt, hoppy, fruity aroma. Sweet, malt, fruity taste, lsightly bitter. Light to medium body.

Botella de 33 cl de el lúpulo. (Cons pref para 21-06-2014) 05-06-2014 En el momento. Color rubio amarillento turbio con espuma blanca no muy persistente. Sabores y aromas maltosos con ligeros toques herbáceos y afrutados cítricos y un final amargo no muy persistente. Bien de carbónico, generando espuma en todo momento. Buena cerveza con bajo nivel de alcohol de 3 vol y con cuerpo ligero aunque con sabores intensos. Buena, para repetir.

Bottle sample at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2014. Queue for 4th Session. Pours yellow with a small head, fresh aroma of pomelo, tangerine and lemon, flavor is bitter with lemon, pomelo, medium bodied.

duft: lime. citrus. frisk frugt.
smag: danskvand.lime. lidt sødme. lidt bitterhed
On tap. Pours hazy pale yellow with a white head. The aroma is fruity hoppy. The flavor is exotic hops and citrus.
Trübes goldenes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr bitter fruchtig, hopfig, Geschmack leicht fruchtig, hopfig, grasig, bitter.
Bottle at Nya Tröls. A decent pale ale dominated by a caramelly-malt and a heap of tropical hops.

UPDATED: MAY 17, 2014 [5/3/14] Bottle sample at Copenhagen Beer Celebration. Queue for 4th session. Cloudy yellow. Lovely fruity hops aroma. Flavor of zesty fruity hops. Medium-bodied. Very nice and refreshing.
Pale cloudy light golden colour. Thin head. Slight bitterness. Grapefruit aromas. Better than many stronger beers.

330ml bottle from local supermarket.Pale light golden color, very small head. Sweet musty biscuit aroma. Nice summery flavor with pine needles and lemon notes. Lightly citrus aftertaste. Great flavors for a low alcohol beer. Refreshing.

Summer beer. Easy. Sometimes too easy. Metallic at times. Quite a changer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
herb aromas, appear pale, without head. taste medium bitter. a fizzy mouthfeel, with a short bitter aftertaste.
330ml bottle from Hippo Beers. Pale yellow amber colour, not much head. Sweet resin biscuit hop aroma. Zingy pine lemon flavour. Bitter citrus aftertaste. Big flavour for a low alcohol beer.

Bottle @ home. schiuma bianca fine e persistente. Birra giallo dorato opalescente, qualche riflesso aranciato. Aroma fruttato, di pompelmo rosa, estremamente luppolata (agrumata e resinosa) e forse un po di frumento.
Gusto secco, piuttosto amara, luppolatura americana ben distinguibile. gusto agrumato di pompelmo. Poco corposa, al limite dello spigoloso, ma dal gusto pieno nonostante il basso ABV. equilibrata ed armonica.
Bottle @ formand Søren. Slightly clouded yellow, small white head, okay lacing. Aroma, malty, caramel, hoppy fruity, citrus, mango. Similar taste, tho slightly weaker.

Bottle from Mane Liquor Dungeon of Debauchery. Pours straw yellow with a fairly lively carbonation. Upfront aroma of citrus fruits, wheaty malts and a touch of lemon peel. Pretty big aroma considering the low alcohol. Flavours are also relatively present - nice citrus and zest flavours combined with an light malt backbone and clean body. No outstanding bitterness, great light beer!

Bottle rated 2.11.2012. Slightly hazy pale yellow color, small white head. Strong aroma of gooseberries and catpiss. Light bodied. Crisp. Quite fruity with kiwi, watermelon and citrus. Almost fruity-sweet. Nice session LA.

Draught @ Youll Never Walk Alone in Kolding. Pours hazy pale yellow with airy white head. Clear aroma of citrus and hops. Bitter, hoppy aroma with basically nothing to support it. Watery mouthfeel. Bitter aftertaste. Not well balanced. Nothing tonwrite home about.

UPDATED: FEB 22, 2014 Old rating, 0,33l bottle @ home:
Frisk fruktig lukt med preg av lys malt, humle, grapefrukt, sitrusskal, svovel, barnåler, høy, gras, tørka frukt. Frisk tørr smak med preg av lys malt, humle, høy, sitrusskal, barnåler, gras, sitrus, våte blad. Middels bitterhet som set litt. God.

A golden yellow coloured beer with a frothy white head. A heady hop aroma, tropical fruit and a touch piney. Dry mouthfeel. A zesty bitter taste, tropical fruits again, grapefruit, lemon, passion fruit and mango. There is a smoother, cereal-type flavour in the background that comes further into the fore in the finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draught. Aroma is hoppy with citrus notes. Very little malt aroma. Flavour is hoppy with little malt, hops are citrus and grapefruit. Seems to be a little watery, but very nice.
Bottle (33 cl) from various supermarkets. Shady golden, medium white head. Fresh piney and citric hop aroma. Light bodied, medium carbonation. Dry with medium bitterness. A very good thirst quencher.

14th November 2012Light haze on this gold beer, little white head. Light crisp palate. A little malt cream, pretty light. Nice fresh hops - floralness, orange, tangerine and a little peel. Minerals. Pith. Light finish. Nice hop flavours but the beer is thin. Refreshing.

Cloudy golden with a lasting white head. Classic citrus hop aroma with plenty of pine on top, and orange peel, peach and green hops. Dry, thin and bitter flavour, with a wonderfully aggressive hop attack - not balanced at all, but a great session beer for hop extremists.

Bottle 33cl from Henrik thanks, a cloudy yellow beer with low head. Nose is very hopy on the fruit side, apricot and grapefruit., simcoe notes. Aroma is very fruity on the same, red fruits, apricot, mangoo. body is a bit low but whole beer is very nice and interesting, refreshing, good.
260713. Bottle at Naamat, Tampere. Pours hazy yellow with a small head. Aroma floral hoppy notes. Light palate. Nice.

Hop forward aroma, catty lemon, grapefruit citrus, very slight resinous hops. Hazy straw colour. Nice, long lasting white head though fades a little yet sticks around a bit. Flavour becomes a little maltier and heavier, bready malt appears. Body is still quite light, finish is quick, hoppy yet pleasant. At 3.5% its just what I need right now, good beer.

Bottle from K-market, Järvenpää. Clear light golden color, medium white head. Nice hoppy and sweet aroma, fruits, some corn. Medium body, refreshing hoppy taste, some malty sweetness. Hoppy end. Not bad at all.

Dobre piwo z nuta goryczki lekkiej cierpkosci. Aromat owocow egzotycznych zwlaszcza grejfrutow. W smaku takze intensywny smak rozowego grejfruta. Piana ladna, srednia ale opada szybko. Finisz wytrawny gdyz amerykanskie chmiele tu rzadza. Nisko alkocholowy lager, ale niespotykanie tresciwy i smaczny.
Bottle at bar. Golden color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, grapefruit, floral hops and pine. Bitter finish with grapefruit and grass. Very nice pale ale with low ABV.

Bottle. Pours a very appetising Gold with a durable, fluffy White head. Aroma of fresh summer. Passionfruit, Mango, Oranges. Flavour is all that and a touch of lemon zest. Its undenyably thin but not as thin as youd expect from the ABV. Its a bit of a hallmark beer. Who says low ABV means low flavour? That kind of thing... It has a nice bitterness to finish. A real summery treat.
Pours yellow with a small white head. Aroma is malt, peach, citrus, flower and tropical fruit. Flavour is malt, peach, tropical fruit, citrus and flower. A little thin.

33cl bottle. Pours clear golden with medium white frothy head. Lovely aroma: orange peel, tangerine and hints of yeast. The flavour is citrusy (lemon-orange), some wheat as well, and ends with soft bitterness in the back. Dry palate with spicy bubbles (subttle). No alcohol at all as expected (Low Alcohol). Light/Medium mouthfeel, good carbonation. Very good for sunny days, refreshing! This could be renamed as: Low Alcohol APA. Basically what it is.

Der blumige Geruch entäuscht nicht, das Bier startet angenehm hopfig, wenn auch etwas dumpf. Geringe Bitterkeit, grasig, süffig. Der dumpfe Eindruck lässt mit der Zeit nach, die Intensität des Bieres leider ebenfalls. Passend bitterer Ausklang. 7/8/8/9/7/8
At home from a bottle. Really nice and fresh taste. Mildly but noticeable bitter. Not at all watery which is surprising for such a low alcohol beer. Really good!

(Bottle, from NK Saluhall, Stockholm) Golden colour, slightly hazy, with frothy white head. Fruity, hoppy nose with lychee, passion-fruit, mandarin, grapefruit and floral hops. Fruity, hoppy taste with lychee, grapefruit, resin, passion-fruit, grainy malt, cereal and a finish with fresh, citric, resinous hops. Fairly short bitterness. Light body, quite dry. Fresh and tasty low alcohol pale ale. Nice one.

33 cl bottle from the NK deli store, Stockholm. BB 21/06/14, sampled on March 31, 2013.Clear golden color, a bit fluffy white head that leaves lacings on the glass. Hoppy, citrus, apricots, herbal, a bit sweet scent. Hoppy, some resin, bitter taste. Not as fresh as the scent. To the thin side mouthfeel, medium high dry bitterness. Very decent low alcohol beer, if I liked the dry bitter beers more this would be a great every day beer to have when wanting to stay away from the bigger effects of alcohol.

Bottled. Golden coloured, Unclear. Dense off white head. Aroma. Sweetness, yeast, fruits, Light flowers. Flavour. Sweetness, flowers, fruits, Spice, medium bodied. Crisp. Ends sweet and Light flowers bitter.

Det här är riktigt kul, en bra öl med oväntat låg alkoholhalt. Aromen på den här ölen är dessutom värd att döda för. Smaken följer upp på ett okej vis, men ölen faller platt när det kommer till balans och kropp. Men det är fortfarande en riktigt bra öl.
Helt underbar aroma. Någon sorts godis avspeglar sig i aroman, har bara svårt att sätta fingret på det. Aroman är FRUKTANSVÄRT imponerande aroma för den låga akoholhalten.

Bottle.  Cloudy golden beer with a strong head.  The aroma is fruity and dry with done yeastiness, and the flavour is dry with quite a long finish.  Overall a reasonable but fairly average dry and hopped beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Clear yellow with a small white bubbly head. Aroma is pineapple, citrus zest, fruity, light pale malt. Taste is light sweet and light+ bitter. Light+ body, watery texture, medium carbonation.

330ml bottle from Archive Beer Boutique. Bright clear golden amber colour with a fluffy white head, well carbonated. Passionfruit in the aroma is nice and was unexpected. Lively in the mouth and again there is a strong presence of passionfruit. If only all low alcohol beers were this good. Perfect beer for this hot scorcher of a day,
Golden coloured beer, small head. To small. Very fruity, more taste as expected.
33 cl bottle. Clear pale golden beer with a medium offwhite head. Hoppy and fruity (tropical) aroma and similar flavour. Nice refreshing beer :-)

Bottle: Thanks Papsø:
Medium sized fluffy white head, changes quick into a fluffy lacing on top of an almost clear yellow colored beer.
Smell is a crispy mix of: crispy hops, crispy citrus, hints of mango, apricot and grapefruit, crispy herbs, hop flowers, hint of soap and other crispy citrus fruit.
Taste is a bit of a thin mix (but decent, absolutely for 3%
abv) of hops, citrus, flowers, bitters, hint of malts, hint of herbs,slight hint of yeast, some crispy hop fruit tones and floral hops. Bit watery but quite refreshing.
Aftertaste is pretty light. Theres some bitterness, light dryness, crispy hop tones and some floral notes.
Low to medium carbo, soft light foamy creamy mouthfeel, low to medium body and a light creamy texture.
Easy drinkable, you notice the few alcohol percentage, like a thin ipa. Pretty good!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Bottle. Clear gold with a thin head. Aroma is tropical fruits. Flavour is bittersweet fruit with a sudsy bitter finish, long bitter palate

Dampolla. Color or amb espuma blanca. Aroma de cítrics i llúpol floral. El sabor és amarg. El cos és lleuger amb una textura fina. Final amarg de llúpol florals i cítrics. Pel poc còs que te molt bona cervesa refrescant.

330ml bottle, bbe 21/06/14. Pours a pretty and slightly hazy golden light orange with a bubbly white head. Aroma is floral and fruity hops, citrus, some sharp tropical fruit, hay. Taste has some fruit, citrus, grass/hay with a bitter finish. Palate is crisp and soft. Light to medium body, not as thin as one might think. An excellent, refreshing sessionable.
Bottle. Golden colour with a white head. Aroma is citrus, malt, hop, pine. Flavour is citrus, malt, hop, pine. Medium body. OK low alcohol.

Bottle. Hazy golden color with a small white head. Fruity aroma with notes of grapefruit and lemon. Flavor is also quite fruity with grapefruit, lemon, pine and some bitterness. Light body, slightly bitter aftertaste.
Bottle From Dranken Geers. Pale colour, minimal head. smells very floral, like citrus and elderberry blossom. medium body but still good for such a light beer.

Bottle from NK Saluhall, December 2012.

A bit hazy golden with a large white head. Hoppy aroma and taste, pineapple, grape and some orange. Light body. Descent given the low ABV.
Bottled, from NK, Stockholm.  Hazy palem golden, small head. Lychee aroma.. Dry with light body and clen, rounded mouthfeel. Plenty of soapy lychee. Mid bitter finish.
Bottle 0.33l from local market. Colour is hazy golden with large white head. Aromas and flavour are grape, citrus and grassy hops. Fresh, quite sour.

Bottle at the Earl of Essex, London. Thanks to Jack for the share. Pours lightly hazy gold with a fine, creamy white head. Smells of urine and tangerine. Light sweet flavor with dry citrus, some melon, tangerine, orange. Light bodied with fine to average to lively carbonation. Mild dry finish, dry grapefruit, melon, tangerine. Very fresh and clean, if a bit light.

Small fluffy yellowish head over clear golden beer with faint orange sheen. Very fruity USA hops nose, but unfortunately also a lot of cats pee, valerian. Bit of pancake dough. Bitter-fruity; pure citrussy hopoils. Faint toasted malt, lemonsquash. Very spritzy, light  but not watery, fading main flavours. And of course very refreshing. Anoter excellent new-style low alcohol. Not quite the Mont Salève Soriachi, but deserving enough - AND the first Belgian-brewed! Aha!

33 cl. bottle. Slightly hazy, golden colour with a small, white head. Aroma with lots of citrus and floral hops, sweet fruit and grasses. Light soap and a little bit of malts. Taste is bitter. Body is light  with a thinner texture, lively carbonated. Bitter finish with floral and citrus hops, some grapefruit. Excellent for a low alcohol, lots of aroma and flavour for a 3 % alc. beer.

330ml Bottle - Hazy golden in colour. Grapefruit, tea, lemon and herbs in the aroma. Hoppy, soapy and tangy taste with grapefruit, passion fruit and lychees detected. Very refreshing and has got plenty of flavour for the strength.

33cl from Geers, BB 21/06/2014.
Dorée, léger trouble, col blanc moyen.
Arôme est agréablement houblonné, citronné, entre tropical; citronné et pamplemousse avec une pointe malt type.
Palais est houblonné avec une amertume fine, le tout donne une belle fraicheur en bouche allant vers herbacé et citronné, effervescence est moyenne. Sèche et sessionable.

A golden, slightly hazy beer with a medium and blond head. Aroma is fruitfull and malty, grass, some spices and citrusfruits. Surprisingly complex aroma. Taste is fruitfull and also some tropical fruits, medium bitterness that is citrusfruity and slightly grassy. Light+  bodied, but not watery. Quite nice, balanced and aromatic beer.

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; cloudy yellow pour, went in for my first sip and I got a glorious tropical & zesty aroma, I thought this going to be good. But the taste was a let down only slight hop taste but very watery. Ok for a low ABV beer.

330ml bottle (shared by FatPhil). Clear golden color. Nice white head appears, stays. Pineapple, grapefruit dominates the aroma. Hoppy, watery, grapefruit in flavor. Its like drinking water with grapefruit seeds soaked in it. Quite nice actually.

330ml bottle (K Kamppi, Tallinn)
Nice fruity hop aroma - red grapefruit, some pineapple, even a hint of coconut, later more and more grapefruit, and less sweet, all the way to yellow grapefruit eventually. Pretty watery palate, a bit fizzy carbonation. Nice hoppy taste, pretty grapefruity. Rather thin. No flaws, and an interesting experiment, but not actually good enough to satisfy my palate. Too watery, basically.

Golden clear. All in the nose but what a nose. Plenty of pearch apricot notes. Crisp bitterness. Super nice light brew. Of course one the best ever tasted.

Bottle at 3.0% ABV. Pours light brown. Bit hazy. Medium white head. Smells of hops, grass and peach. Taste a bit citric mixed with light hops and orange. Short bitterness that stays on for a short period of time. Leaves the palate a little bit too early though and could be a slightly bitter for my taste. However, a really good beer at a low ABV. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Hazy yellow colour with a white head. Aroma: hops, citrus, flowers, a bit of sweat. Flavor: hops, citrus, fruity, very balanced bitterness. Light and maybe a bit watery mouthfeel. Great session beer for the summer time.

Bottle 33 cl. Cloudy goldenorange in color, whitish head. Citrus, parfrume, dishwasher in aroma. Malty, floral and loads of citrus in taste. Pretty tasty and impressive considering the low abv. Nice one.

Bottled. Pale golden colour with a small white head. Aroma is citrus, some grass, bready malts as well as some zesty and toffeeish notes. Flavour is sweet floral and fruity notes with mild maltyness. Nice bitterness in the finish.

Bottle 330ml.Clear medium orange yellow colour with a small to average, frothy - fizzy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white to white head. Aroma is moderate malty, fruity, moderate hoppy, pine, grapefruit, grass. Flavour is moderate sweet and bitter with a long to average duration, thin, dry, hoppy. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20120915]

Bottle at Craigs 271012
Light straw, white rim head, slight haze
Aroma - nice fresh citrus zesty hops, fruity pale malts, lemon, good aroma
Taste - gentle citrus hops, orange, lemon, nice light zesty bitterness
Palate - soft carb, thin body. Finish as main flavour, nice soft fruity hops
Overall - Its a little thin (but it is only 3%) - nice and refreshing

In bottle at Craigs. Pours a blonde colour with fair white head. Aroma of passion fruit, pineapple, pine, caramel and alcohol. Similar flavours with mild carbonation and an oily mouth-feel. Alcohol is well balanced. Mildly bitter with a dry finish. Lovely lingering passion fruit again.
bottle at home ... light amber .. thin white head ... soft golden amber ... thin white head ... soft lemon ... dry lemon zezt ... quite dry
Clear golden of color with a white head. An aroma of hops, flowers, perfume,  armgas, fruity and fresh. A flavor of hops, citrus, bitter, weak malt, bread and with a dry finish.

0.33 l bottle, thanks hanniku! Golden color. Strong flowery and citrusy hop aroma with fresh cut grass, onions and hint of phenols. Dry crisp bitter taste with minerals, citrus and grass. Light bodied, a palate similar to hard mineral water with some hop tannins also. Good aroma but flavor is far too minerally.

Easy drinking low alcohol beer. You cant detect that its a LA, lots of hops giving a great aroma and taste. Good balance of hops malt and yeast.
A beer to kickstart the evening.

Draught at the Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen, Denmark.
Clear white wine colour with no head. 
Some mild sweetness, yeast and mild hops in aroma. 
Weak flavour of sweetness, hops and yeast.
Hmm... theres sweat too. Not my favourite.
Bottle. Pours light golden with a white head. Aroma of citrus, herbs, peach, spruce and some fruitiness.  Flavor is sweet and hoppy with some citrus and bitterness. Thin body, average carbonation.

Bottle. It pours a clear, golden body and a small, white head. Mostly citrusy nose, some pine cones and pale malts. Quite dry on the palate, a bit thin of course, and soft on the carbonation. Citrus peel, some pine cones, lemon notes and a touch of biscuity pale malts. Citrusy finish with a pleasant bitterness. A pleasant, tasteful, refreshing and easy drinkable beer. 121019

Bottle 330ml @ Geokkjer
Pours clear golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, citrus, pine. Taste is light sweet and medium bitter. Body is light, texture is thin, carbonation is soft.

Bottle 33 cl. Pours yellow with a slight haze and a small white head. Very fresh aroma with loads of citrus and tropical accents. Light body, smooth mouthfeel, very fruity from great aromatic hops and a dry but not overly bitter finish. 191012
Sample at SBWF 2012. It had a hoppy smell of melons, grape, mango and some ripe fruit. Fairly sweet smell. Milder taste with a nice bitterness and very light malt body.
33 cl bottle @ home. Pours slightly cloudy golden with a white head that leaves a little lacing. Aroma is fruity and floral hops, malt, and grains. Flavour is floral hops, malt, and grains.

From Hophead, DK.
Bottled, 101012.
Golden with white head. Aroma of citrus and fruit. Flavour with malt and spices.

Bottle. Pours hazy pale golden yellow with white head. Aroma is nice, a little dusty, grassy with some very pleasant floral and fruity hop notes, lemon and mango. Taste is very delicious, orange, grapefruit, mango and pine all in small well measured and balanced proportions. Very clean and crisp throughout, a little thin as would be expected  but the body is ok for its abv. A very tasty and extremely drinkable beer. I could sink a dozen of these
0,33 l bottle from Länsiväylä. Pours pale yellow with a medium head. Aroma is malts and fruits. Flavor is malts with some hops. A bit watery. Suffers a bit from the low ABV.

Clear light golden with a small white head. Both the aroma and taste is focused on the hops that bring mango, orange, passion fruit and some tobacco. the malt very far in the background and itt very dry with a bitter ending, making it a perfect summer beer. Still, the lack of body makes it quite unbalanced.

Bottled from Ica Maxi Mölndal
Hazy yellow with a medium, white head.
Very fruity and sweetish aroma; tropical fruits, grapefruit and lemon,
Flowery perfumeish flavour with a light, to medium bitterness. Smooth mouthfeel. Pretty thin body.
My overall rating reflects the quality of this beer vs abv. Really fresh beer which reminds me of summer during october :)

Bottle bought @ Ica Maxi Grafiska Vägen. Pours tiny hazy golden with a frothy and fizzy white head that leaves some sticky lacing and trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is very hoppy fresh with grapefruit juice, soap, papaya, pineapple, mango, orange zest, grass, oily pine, crackers and green grapes. Taste is tiny sweet, slightly bitter and hoppy fresh with crackers,  grapefruit juice, goosberries, green grapes, moist grass, orange zest, lemon zest, blackcurrants, unripe mango, unripe pineapple and hints of resin and pine. Mouthfeel is crisp, watery and light bodied. Fionish is bitter with crackers, grapefruit rinds, orange zest, moist grass, gooseberries, blackcurrants and hints of unripe tropical fruits and pine. I find this very nice, extremely drinkable and refreshing. Didnt take many minutes to finish the bottle.

Bottle at Stockholm Beer and Whiskey Festival 2012. Almost clear, yellow liquid with medium white head. Aroma of grass, citrus, biscuit, grain, pine and tropical fruit. Taste is dry and medium bitter with notes of citrus and tropical fruit. Light bodied with medium carbonation. A bit watery. Good for a 3% beer.

Bottle from ICA, Mölndal. Golden beer with à decent white head, quite carbonated. Floral grass aroma, hay, herbal, malty, bready, pine, mango notes. Hoppy floral flavor, grass, herbal, citrus, mango, pine, hay, some peach and with spicy notes. Really good for being with this low ABV.

330ml bottle. Minimally cloudy golden colour with small to average, macropore to frothy, white head. Hoppy aroma has herbal notes, resin, a touch of elder, elderberry. Taste is minimally sweet and sourish, hoppy with herbal notes, elder, some resin, bitter finish.

Bottle. Pours a nice cloudy yellow with a white head. Aroma is light and hoppy with notes of peach, floral notes, sweet malt, orange and some slight pine. The flavor follows the nose and is light and juicy, I get the peach and floral notes, with the orange and pine and some sweeter malt notes. The body is light with a dry mouth feel. Overall a solid light ABV Steam Beer.

Clear golden pour with a white head. A bit of citrus along with some grass and straw. A light malty sweetness of bread. The flavor has a bit more of a bread and cracker malt note. Some tropical fruit sweetness, a bit of citrus, grass, and minimal bitterness. Pretty simple and easy to drink.
dorata buona schiuma piuttosto persitenten naso fruttato lupplatura agrumata pescapoco corpo beveroina amaro medio leggero citrico

Bottle, bought @ Kihoskh, Cph. Pours hazy dark yellow with a medium, frothy, white head. Aroma has lots of hops, citrus, pine, resin, orange peel. Medium carbonation, fine dryish and light mouthfeel. Flavour is quite elegant soft maltiness, a good deal of citric hops. Grapefruit, soft pine.

UPDATED: OCT 7, 2012 Bottle from ICA Maxi Mölndal cons 2012-09-24 Göteborg
AR: lemon, mango, apricot but most of all peach
AP: copper, frothy wee transparent white head
F: fizzy, lemon juice, grape fruit, citric dryness, fruit sweetness, apricot, mango, wee peach

33 cl bottle, thanks to Ungstrup. Pours cloudy yellow with a small white head. Aroma is smooth peachy, wineous and light light floral. Floral, wineous and peachy smooth. Bitter and fruity and towards floral. Smooth fruity finish.

Bottled. A golden beer with a white head. The aroma has notes of citrusy hops, wheat, and pilsner malt. The flavor is sweet with notes of citrusy hops, wheat, and malt, leading to a dry bitter finish.
33cl, new exclusive Danish brew Anno 2012, from De Bierkoning Amsterdam, complex brew, malty/fruity and slightly bitter, easy to drink, balanced, hazy, small head, good Summer brew

33cl bottle from C-market, Kerava. BBE 06/2014. Hazy golden, thin white head. Cats pee, malt and citrus aroma. Flavor has fruity hops, citrusy, bitter. Watery, thin body, highly carbonated. Not much flavorwise, but refreshing.  Lawn mower beer.
Bottle @ Really late Summer Tasting Ulfborg, 2012. Pours cloudy golden with a white head. Grapefruit, melon and pine. Really fresh, fruity and dry. Thin. Bitter hoppy finish.
Bottle @ FOneFan. Clear golden with small off-white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, hops and peach. Flavour is malt, hops, peach, fruit, citrus, little grapefruit, medium bitter and a little watery.
Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Clear yellow with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and rather hoppy - peach. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. Watery. 150912

Ar simcoe, passionfruit, Citric, resin, pineapple, grapefruit, sweet malts, very appealing.
Ap: Light golden colour, medium white head.
F: big bite, Citric, grapefruit, washing up liquid, resin, pine, very likable.
M: Good body considering ABV, sharp carbonation.
T: This is very good!
Bottle.Dark golden colour with medium off-white head.Aroma is frutiy of citrus and pineapple,hint of toffee caramel and hops,mild and well balanced with sweet slight dry finish.

Bottle. Slightly hazy orange with a big, frothy but quickly diminishing white head and a little lacing too. Crisp, fresh and fruity hop aroma with a nice dose of almost perfumery, sweet citrusy notes. Oily texture, lively carbonation, light body. Finish is fruity hoppy and light bitter. Extremely high drinkabilty.

UPDATED: SEP 9, 2012 (33 cl bottle from Bjergtrolden; BBD: June 2014) Pours a clear golden with little, white head and lively carbonation. Nice lacing. Aroma is floral hoppy with sodapop notes. Oily texture, light body and a nice, slightly bitter finish with plenty of clean aroma notes.pleasant and very sessionable.

33 cl bottle.
Pours clear golden color with a medium-sized frothy head. Aroma of floral hops, toffee, fruits, some fruity caramel and grass. Flavor of mild fruits, some hops, hay and some lemon. Nice aroma but the taste is not as good.
3513

33 cl bottle @ home, BBE 21.06.2014
Aroma is rather nice and slightly sweet with some fruity hops, gooseberry bush and fruit candy. Flavour is hoppy with some fruity hops, gooseberry bush and hints of fruit candy. Also a bit vichy-like feeling typical to low ABV beers.

330 ml bottle.
Pours a clear pale golden colour with a large white foamy head. Aroma is very intense with floral hops, citrus and some toffee. Lovely aroma. Flavour of pale malts, strong bitter hops, citrus, toffee, grass and some menthol-like notes. Light bodied, thin mouthfeel and high carbonation. Very light finish of hops, light citric notes and some grass. Aroma was a lot better than the flavour, but still this is truly a summery brew.

Bottle at home.
Light hazy yellow with a white head, ok lacings. Aroma medium hoppy (flowery, fruity), light malty. Flavor light sweet, medium bitter, light spicy, dry. Light body.
Bottle. Pours a golden color with a white head. Has a fruity floral hoppy citrus aroma. Fruity thin malty hoppy peachy flavor. Has a fruity malty peachy hoppy finish.

330ml bottle from K-Supermarket Kamppi
BBE 21.06.14 - Pours clear pale yellow with a bubbly head. Aroma of fruits, crisp grassy hops, some hints of malts. Taste is hoppy and light bodied with some grassy and fruity notes, grapefruit and lemon. Finish is fruity and bitter with hoppy notes and slight hints of biscuity malts. Fruity and hoppy beer, but feels like the body is missing.

UPDATED: SEP 15, 2012 Tap @ Mikkeller bar. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are rich hops, pine, citrus and malt. Rerated @ fonefan tasting 8/3/7/3/14. Initial rating 7/3/7/3/14

Draught at Mikkeller Bar.
Clear golden coloured with a medium sized white head.
Fruity aroma of hops, citrus peel and pine needles.
Fruity flavour of citrus peel, hops and pine needles with notes of exotic fruits and petroleum.
Hoppy finish, but light watery.

Smell is so and so with tropical fruits hidden behind a grassy and murky aroma. Apperance is beutiful with a semi-transparent golden hue and a crisp, white head. Taste is bursting with passion fruit and mango together with a lemony tang to it. The beer is surprisingly thick on the palate and the high carbonation only adds to its refreshing taste. Overall its probably one of the best low alcohol beers Ive ever had the pleasure to try.
Bottle. Pours golden with a white head. Ridiculously sweet and tropical hop dominated aroma. Crisp and citrusy taste. Quite bitter.

Bottle at Pizza Hatt.
Light hoppy aroma.
Drinkable but a bit too bitter taste like from nelson and citrusy hops.
Bottle at home - shared with Mette. Clear yellow - white head. Light body, nice hoppy, light fruity, citrus, dry crispy, light peachy, light malty, wheaty notes. Very refreshing.
Clear nice deep golden colour. Fresh hoppy fruity aroma. Ok mouthfeel, bit thin. Flavour is fresh and mild like with a fruity hoppiness. Great refreshing low alc. lager.
